intro: Schachtia dioica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and prominent stamens, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Schachtia dioica is often found in temperate climates and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological importance to pollinators.
